exchange_code_error.generic: Something went wrong with granting access to {{data_provider_name}}.
exchange_code_error.no_code:
Did not receive a code for {{data_provider_name}}. This likely happened because you decided not to allow $t(ui.app.name.full) to access your data.
If this was a mistake, you can click '$t(ui.project.survey_platform.code_exchange.connection.button.go_back)' and then connect to {{data_provider_name}} again to grant the necessary scopes.
exchange_code_error.access_denied: You denied granting access to your data.
exchange_code_error.unexpected_error: An unexpected error occurred while granting access.
exchange_code_error.general_error: An unexpected error occurred while processing your request.
exchange_code_error.incomplete_scopes: You did not grant access to all the required scopes for this survey. Click '$t(ui.project.survey_platform.code_exchange.connection.button.go_back)' and then connect to {{data_provider_name}} again to grant the necessary scopes.

introduction.title: What is Data-Driven Surveys (DDS)?
introduction.content: Data-Driven Surveys (DDS) is a platform that enables survey designers to create data-driven surveys. A data-driven survey is a survey that uses respondents' data from various online platforms (e.g., Fitbit, Instagram, Github, Google Contacts, etc.) for survey customization, personalization, pre-answering, and background information collection.

supported_data_providers.title: Supported Data Providers
supported_data_providers.content: DDS supports the following data providers:

why_we_request_access_to_your_data.title: Why We Request Access to Your Data
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.content: To provide a customized survey experience, DDS may request access to your data from the following platforms (the platforms requested vary for each survey):
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.content2: We use this data to enhance the relevance and personalization of the surveys, ensuring that the questions you receive are more meaningful and tailored to you. We never share your data with third parties, and you maintain full control over which data you choose to share.
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.fitbit: Your fitness activity and health data (average steps, weekly active minutes, etc.) to tailor survey questions related to health and wellness.
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.instagram: Your Instagram activity (number of posts made, etc.) enables customizing surveys for instagram users. For example, by avoiding having to ask about basic information about your social media profiles.
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.github: Information from your Github profile (number of starred repositories, etc.) allows us to customize surveys for developers or tech professionals.
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.googlecontacts: Your Google Contacts data allows calculating various statistics related to how you use Google Contacts. For example, the total number of contacts you have and how many of your contacts have a phone number.
why_we_request_access_to_your_data.spotify: Your Spotify data allows computing your music preferences and Spotify usage habits. For example, the playlists you have saved.

how_we_use_your_data.title: How We Use Your Data
how_we_use_your_data.content: Here is a summary of how DDS uses your data:
how_we_use_your_data.content1: Before any survey begins, DDS provides a summary of the data that will be accessed and how it will be used in the survey. This summary takes on the form of a variables table, where each variable has an explanation for how it is calculated. You can review this information before granting access, and you have the option to decline any data sharing requests for each individual data provider. No data is actually accessed until you have chosen to proceed with the survey.
how_we_use_your_data.content2: Once you choose to proceed to your survey, DDS will download only the data needed to compute the variables mentioned in the variables table. After computing the variables, DDS will delete all the data that was downloaded from your accounts. DDS will also revoke access to your account(s). DDS will then upload the calculated variables to the survey platform, ensuring that your data remains secure and private. DDS will then delete the calculated variables on its end. After this you will be redirected to the survey platform where you can begin answering the questions.
how_we_use_your_data.step0: Before any survey begins, DDS provides a summary of the data that will be accessed and how it will be used in the survey. This summary takes on the form of a variables table, where each variable has an explanation for how it is calculated.
how_we_use_your_data.step1: Next, you can choose to grant access to the data providers that are requested for the given survey. You have the option to decline any data sharing requests for each individual data provider. No data is actually accessed until you have chosen to proceed with the survey.
how_we_use_your_data.step2: Once you choose to proceed to your survey, DDS will download only the data needed to compute the variables mentioned in the variables table. After computing the variables, DDS will delete all the data that was downloaded from your accounts. DDS will also revoke access to your account(s). DDS will then upload the calculated variables to the survey platform, ensuring that your data remains secure and private. DDS will then delete the calculated variables on its end.
how_we_use_your_data.step3: Finally, you will be redirected to the survey platform where you can begin answering the questions.

privacy_and_security.title: Privacy and Security
privacy_and_security.content: Your privacy is our priority. DDS only collects the minimum amount of data necessary to personalize your survey experience. We use encryption to protect your data during transmission, and your data is deleted immediately after processing. Your data is never shared with third parties, and you can revoke access at any time. If you do not revoke access yourself, DDS will revoke access automatically after calculating all the required variables.

more_information.title: More Information
more_information.content: For more information about DDS, please see our:
more_information.paper: Research Paper that gives an in-depth presentation of DDS

contact_information.title: Contact Information
contact_information.content: If you have any questions, please contact us at

researcher_login.title: Survey Designer Login
researcher_login.content: If you are a survey designer, please log in using your email address and password.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: DDS respects the privacy of its users and is committed to protecting the personal information collected through its platform. This Privacy Policy outlines the types of information we collect, how it is used, and the measures we take to protect your information.

data_collection_and_use.title: Data Collection and Use
data_collection_and_use.content: DDS collects and uses personal information in the following ways:

information_you_provide.title: Information You Provide
information_you_provide.content: DDS offers the possibility to collect data from various online platforms that survey respondents may use. This data includes, but is not limited to, information provided by the survey respondent from their linked accounts on the various Data Providers (DPs) such as Fitbit, Google Contacts, and others, under explicit authorization using OAuth protocols.

automatically_collected_information.title: Automatically Collected Information
automatically_collected_information.content: DDS automatically receives and records information on our server logs from your browser, including your IP address, cookie information, and the page you request.

google_user_data.title: Google User Data
google_user_data.content: As part of integrating with Google Contacts and Google account information, DDS may access the following Google user data:

google_account_information.title: Google Account Information
google_account_information.content: Basic account information such as the account name and email address associated with the Google account, used to identify the user and display the account that provided access.

google_contacts_information.title: Google Contacts Information
google_contacts_information.content: Names, email addresses, phone numbers, and other details stored in Google Contacts.

how_we_use_your_data.title: How We Use Your Data
how_we_use_your_data.content: The data we collect from Google and other Data Providers is used to personalize and customize the survey experience and for displaying information in the DDS user interface. Specifically, we use your data for:

dds_user_interface.title: DDS User Interface
dds_user_interface.content: The username from a given Data Provider (e.g., Google) is displayed in the DDS user interface to inform survey respondents which account they authorized access to.

survey_personalization.title: Survey Personalization and Customization
survey_personalization.content: Data from Google and other Data Providers is used to compute variables that survey designers can use to personalize and customize surveys. This can include using templated questions and answers and applying survey logic.

automated_data_collection.title: Automated Data Collection
automated_data_collection.content: Computed variables allow for the automatic collection of information, removing the need for respondents to manually input data that the system already has access to (e.g., number of contacts).

google_data.title: Google User Data
google_data.content: Google user data is used to calculate variables such as the total number of contacts and the number of contacts with phone numbers. Only aggregate data or summary statistics are calculated from Google Contacts data. No raw Google user data is shared with third parties. Specifically:

dds_user_interface.title: DDS User Interface
dds_user_interface.content: The Google account username is displayed in the DDS interface to show which account authorized access.

survey_personalization.title: Survey Personalization and Customization
survey_personalization.content: Variables computed from Google user data are used to personalize and customize surveys.

automated_data_collection.title: Automated Data Collection
automated_data_collection.content: Variables computed from Google user data enable the automatic collection of information without needing respondents to answer questions that would collect the same information.

sharing_and_disclosure.title: Sharing and Disclosure of User Data
sharing_and_disclosure.content: DDS does not sell, transfer, or disclose any user data to third parties except in the following situations:

survey_platforms.title: Survey Platforms
survey_platforms.content: Aggregated or anonymized data is shared with survey platforms such as Qualtrics and SurveyMonkey. This data is only accessible by the survey designers responsible for the given survey.

legal_compliance.title: Legal Compliance
legal_compliance.content: In cases where DDS is required to comply with court orders or governmental requests, data may be disclosed in accordance with the law.

google_data.title: Google Data
google_data.content: DDS does not share, transfer, or disclose raw Google user data to any third parties, including Google. Google user data is solely used within DDS to compute variables necessary for survey customization. Only aggregated data or summary statistics are shared with survey platforms, and no raw Google Contacts or Google account data is ever disclosed

consent.title: Consent
consent.content: By using DDS, survey respondents consent to the collection, transfer, processing, storage, disclosure, and use of their information as described in this Privacy Policy. Consent is obtained through our landing page where survey respondents are informed about the data collection process and provided with a link to this Privacy Policy.

data_minimization.title: Data Minimization
data_minimization.content: DDS adheres to the principle of data minimization by only requesting access to the necessary data from Google Contacts and other Data Providers, as authorized by the survey respondent. The data accessed is solely used for calculating the required variables for the survey and is deleted after the survey respondent is redirected to take their survey.

security.title: Security
security.content: We employ administrative, physical, and electronic measures designed to protect your information from unauthorized access. All of the mentioned security measures also apply to Google user data. This includes:

oauth.title: OAuth for Secure Data Access
oauth.content: OAuth protocols are used to ensure secure access to the survey respondents' Google and Data Provider accounts.

automatic_access_token_revocation.title: Automatic Access Token Revocation
automatic_access_token_revocation.content: For Data Providers that support remote access token revocation, such as Google Contacts, we automatically revoke the access token once the survey respondent is redirected to their survey.

data_retention_and_deletion.title: Data Retention and Deletion
data_retention_and_deletion.content: DDS does not retain any raw Google user data or other Data Provider data. All data necessary for the survey is temporarily stored in system memory and is deleted immediately after the survey respondent is redirected to take their survey. Access tokens used to retrieve data from Google Contacts and other Data Providers are revoked after the data has been processed.

changes_to_this_privacy_policy.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes_to_this_privacy_policy.content: DDS may update this policy periodically. We will notify you about significant changes by sending a notice to the primary email address specified in a survey designer's DDS account or by placing a prominent notice on our site.

contact_information.title: Contact Information
contact_information.content: If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or data processing, please contact us at: <email>{{contact_email}}</email>

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Welcome to DDS! By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and all applicable laws and regulations.

dds.title: "DDS"
dds.content: refers to the Data-Driven Surveys platform, which integrates with various Data Providers (DPs) to enhance survey experiences.

dp.title: "DPs"
dp.content: refers to the 'Data Providers' that DDS integrates with to enhance survey experiences. Data Providers are third-party services that provide data to DDS.

users.title: "User", "You", or "Your"
users.content: refers to anyone who accesses or uses our Service.

content.title: "Content"
content.content: includes all materials displayed or performed on the DDS platform, including but not limited to text, graphics, news articles, photographs, images, illustrations, and software.

user_accounts.title: User Accounts
user_accounts.content1: To access some features of the platform, you must create an account. You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account, and you are fully responsible for all activities that occur under the account.
user_accounts.content2: You must immediately notify DDS of any unauthorized uses of your account or any other breaches of security.

use_of_the_service.title: Use of the Service
use_of_the_service.content: DDS grants you permission to use the Service as set forth in these Terms, provided that: (i) you will not copy, distribute, or disclose any part of the Service in any medium; (ii) you will not alter or modify any part of the Service other than as may be reasonably necessary to use the Service for its intended purpose; and (iii) you will otherwise comply with the terms and conditions of these Terms.

data_integration.title: Data Integration
data_integration.content1: By using DDS, you consent to the automatic collection of data from your linked DP accounts as necessary for the functionality of the Service.
data_integration.content2: You grant DDS permission to access your data via DPs, under the conditions approved by you, solely for the purpose of creating personalized surveys.

intellectual_property.title: Intellectual Property
intellectual_property.content: All intellectual property rights in the Service and the Content are owned by DDS or DDS's licensors. You may not use any branding or logos used in the Service without prior written consent from DDS.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.content: Your privacy is important to us. Our Privacy Policy explains how we treat your personal data and protect your privacy when you use our Service. By using DDS, you agree that DDS can use such data in accordance with our privacy policies.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: DDS may terminate your access to all or any part of the Service at any time, with or without cause, with or without notice, effective immediately.

disclaimers.title: Disclaimers
disclaimers.content1: The Service is provided "as is". DDS and its suppliers and licensors hereby disclaim all warranties of any kind, express or implied, including, without limitation, the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and non-infringement.
disclaimers.content2: DDS does not warrant that the Service will be error-free or that access thereto will be continuous or uninterrupted.

limitation_of_liability.title: Limitation of Liability
limitation_of_liability.content: In no event will DDS, its suppliers, or licensors be liable with respect to any subject matter of these terms under any contract, negligence, strict liability or other legal or equitable theory for: (i) any special, incidental or consequential damages; (ii) the cost of procurement for substitute products or services; (iii) for interruption of use or loss or corruption of data.

general_representation_and_warranty.title: General Representation and Warranty
general_representation_and_warranty.content: You represent and warrant that (i) your use of the Service will be in strict accordance with the DDS Privacy Policy, with these Terms, and with all applicable laws and regulations (including without limitation any local laws or regulations in your country, state, city, or other governmental area, regarding online conduct and acceptable content).

changes.title: Changes
changes.content: DDS reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or replace any part of these Terms. It is your responsibility to check these Terms periodically for changes.

contact_information.title: Contact Information
contact_information.content: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at
